user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of free_unmarked:
```c
static void
free_unmarked (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp)
{
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_name) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_name)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_name);
    pp->content_name = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_type) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_type)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_type);
    pp->content_type = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_filename) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_filename)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_filename);
    pp->content_filename = NULL;
  }
  if ( (NULL != pp->content_transfer_encoding) &&
       (0 == (pp->have & NE_content_transfer_encoding)) )
  {
    free (pp->content_transfer_encoding);
    pp->content_transfer_encoding = NULL;
  }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I flagged the function declaration (static) because a static function that is not referenced in the translation unit would be unreachable. I flagged each conditional block because their execution depends on runtime values and on macros/flags (the NE_* masks); if those masks are defined such that the conditions are always false/true, or if callers never provide a non-NULL pp or non-NULL members, the corresponding blocks could be effectively unreachable and should be investigated. Other parts of the snippet (braces, spacing, and the repetitive free/NULL-assignment sequence that are contained within the above blocks) are syntactic or are covered by the listed conditional blocks, so they do not need separate investigation. No other constructs that typically produce unreachable code (e.g. code after unconditional return, infinite loops, or mutually exclusive compile-time conditionals outside the flagged areas) are present in this fragment.
